transportAdvice: Caye Caulker is a tiny island where the main village is easily explored on foot, by bicycle, or by golf cart â€” there are no cars. Water taxis connect the island to Belize City and nearby Ambergris Caye, and are the primary mode of inter-island and mainland transport.

weather.description: Cool and dry with pleasant breezes, making it one of the most comfortable months to visit.
Dry and sunny with light trade winds, ideal for snorkeling and diving.
Warm and mostly dry with excellent water visibility for reef activities.
Hot and dry, one of the best months for calm seas and outdoor water sports.
Heat builds and occasional showers begin, but sunny spells are still common.
Rainy season begins in earnest with frequent afternoon showers and higher humidity.
A brief mid-summer dry spell known locally as the 'little dry season' can bring calmer weather.
Warm and wet with heavy rainfall possible; hurricane season is active this month.
Peak of hurricane season with the highest rainfall totals and rough seas possible.
Still rainy and humid with lingering storm risk, though activity begins to taper late in the month.
Rainfall decreases noticeably and conditions begin to improve toward the end of the month.
Dry season returns with cooler temperatures and pleasant breezes, a popular time for visitors.
